intro: Hieracium semicanescens, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features upright stems covered in fine, whitish hairs, and its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets. Hieracium semicanescens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in areas with moderate to dry conditions.
